ARABIC: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهْ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But as for him who is given his Book in his left hand, he will say, 'If only I had not been given my Book
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But whosoever gets his ledger in his left hand, will say: "Would that I were never given my ledger,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: As for him whose Record will be given to him in his left hand, he will exclaim: “Would that I had never been given my Record,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: However, those who will receive the books of the records of their deeds in their left hands will say, "We wish that this record had never been given to us
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And whoever is given his book in his left hand – he will say, “Alas, if only my account were not given to me!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But as for him who will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "I wish that I had not been given my Record!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And as for him who is given his book in his left hand he shall say: O would that my book had never been given me:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he shall say, 'Would that I had not been given my book
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say: Oh, would that I had not been given my book
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But he who is given his record in his left hand will say, "If only I had never been given my Record
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then as to him who shall be vouchsafed his book in his left hand, he shall say: Oh! would that I had not been vouchsafed my book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, ‘I wish I had not been given my book,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And he that will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "Ah! Would that my Record had not been given to me!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But as for him who will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "I wish that I had not been given my Record!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But, he who is given his book in his left hand will say: 'Woe to me, would that my book had not been given to me!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, “I wish I was never given my book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:25] But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, ‘O (yā is for calling attention [to something]) would that I had not been given my book,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But as for him who is given his record in his left hand) this refers to al-Aswad Ibn 'Abd al-Asad, the brother of Abu Salamah who was a disbeliever, (he will say: Oh, would that I had not been given my book) this book 689 of mine
